justification: “We found that there was a significant independent influence of proximity to the choice, indicative of an ‘urgency’ signal… Using a wavelet filter, we computed the inter-hemispheric difference in alpha/beta bands at central electrodes.”

measured_by: parietal and frontal EEG activity (200–450 ms deflection)
justification: “Encoding of |X_k| exhibited a characteristic negative-positive deflection at ~200/450 ms over parietal electrodes, and the sign-reversed pattern in frontal electrodes, replicating the encoding of decision information described previously.”

measured_by: EEG encoding over parietal and frontal electrodes
justification: “Consistent with the predictions of the Adaptive Gain model, there is significant encoding of the prediction error signal over parietal and frontal electrodes 400 ms after stimulus onset.”

measured_by: number of self-paced samples viewed before commitment
justification: “Participants viewed as many Gabor patches (‘samples’) as desired before committing to a choice… we fit the SPRT, DDM and Adaptive Gain models to human stopping times on correct and error trials.”
